document.title: Archdiocese of Milwaukee Curriculum Guide, Grade 5

0EC9253A2D3F4C33931D734F0023D65E.description: Graph generated ordered pairs on a coordinate plane

1EC32B1D862A4E7C8E0A458EDAA9DA56.description: Analyze and explain the relationships between corresponding terms in the two numerical patterns

029FB62FB2444B5580A55B13D7BAC3FA.description: Form ordered pairs consisting of corresponding terms for the two patterns

4CBAD5CC8EEF4CF1957FFF7F91F4F70C.description: Generate two numerical patterns using two given rules

738CBB82E05D47788C904F3870E63C36.description: Generate two numerical patterns using two given rules. Identify apparent relationships between corresponding terms. Form ordered pairs consisting of corresponding terms from the two patterns, and graph the ordered pairs on a coordinate plane. For example, given the rule "Add 3" and the starting number 0, and given the rule "Add 6" and the starting number 0, generate terms in the resulting sequences, and observe that the terms in one sequence are twice the corresponding terms in the other sequence. Explain informally why this is so.

7DF599F518B4418A90BF8C06FCB3F709.description: Write operation words to describe a given numerical expression

B9543F65047D46699D574EB7727316E1.description: Write numerical expressions for given numbers with operation words

292BF053AF3A40C88BA97B133E6FC3B7.description: Interpret numerical expressions without evaluating them

58965C1782324332B19BA5BC3575F1AC.description: Write simple expressions that record calculations with numbers, and interpret numerical expressions without evaluating them. For example, express the calculation "add 8 and 7, then multiply by 2" as 2 × (8 + 7). Recognize that 3 × (18932 + 921) is three times as large as 18932 + 921, without having to calculate the indicated sum or product.

0DB3F6E95C044EE9A0443551A0582276.description: Evaluate expressions using the order of operations (including using parenthesis, brackets, or braces)

ED3690AB24B848299096BEF9CFFB58D1.description: Use order of operations including parenthesis, brackets, or braces

9F24457B426F48F6A4B84DBDD8A3655C.description: Use parentheses, brackets, or braces in numerical expressions, and evaluate expressions with these symbols.

32E9B8586DFB4D8E92B14E7D970E9BBF.description:
Solve real world problems involving division of unit fractions by whole numbers other than 0 and division of
whole numbers by unit fractions using strategies such as visual fractions models and equations

74148B53B22C43C291744BB90DC78FF8.description:
Interpret division of a whole number by a unit fraction and justify your answer using the relationship between
multiplication and division, and by representing the quotient with a visual fraction model

E041B6F0A870424E818BFBAFE08C7000.description:
Interpret division of a unit fraction by a whole number and justify your answer using the relationship between
multiplication and division, by creating story problems, using visual models, and relationship to multiplications,
etc.

3F4D824E37C94C4F8B527EEADE8E9053.description: Know the relationship between multiplication and division

84B04C3EF5454ADD90A2ABFCFA10E134.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of division to divide unit fractions by whole numbers and whole numbers by unit fractions.

69A58F5F4DE245EFB6AF063AD10E1075.description: Solve real world problems involving multiplication of fractions and mixed numbers

AEABA95B05D7491CA43CE8BE567C6F2E.description: Represent word problems involving multiplication of fractions and mixed numbers

3AF016C528104091AE7B121AE98E602E.description: Solve real world problems involving multiplication of fractions and mixed numbers, e.g., by using visual fraction models or equations to represent the problem.

31E62CD2763545A9B65B26D6DD9CB41C.description:
Draw a conclusion that when you multiply a fraction by a fraction, the product will be smaller than the given
number

7A905C6CFDE541F297EEC2DE614930AE.description: Draw a conclusion that when you multiply a fraction by one, the resulting fraction is equivalent

20EA1A949B8F469F909FA09479253628.description:
Draw a conclusion multiplying that a fraction greater than one will result in a product greater than the given
number

9D9F869227214CD7A3045CA312F67B73.description:
Compare the size of a product to the size of one factor on the basis of the size of the other factor without
performing the indicated multiplication

651F2CE628434538B9009DC862574F7D.description:
Know that multiplying whole numbers and fractions results in products greater than or less than one depending
upon the factors

AC978D28FEE143EC94192F999AEEAC29.description: Model the area of rectangles with fractional side lengths with unit squares to show the area of rectangles

FEFBD90EF51749E5982E22B48EA823D5.description: Find area of a rectangle with fractional side lengths using different strategies

8D12DD957E9E4F4C9BD855AE9B504315.description:
Justify multiplying fractional side lengths to find the area is the same as tiling a rectangle with unit squares of the
appropriate unit fraction side lengths

D488A93646DA4B459B0843C21424F469.description: Represent fraction products as rectangular areas

51C2F6E9932A4779B8FD616E0C716429.description: Interpret the product of a fraction times a fraction as the total number of parts of the whole

3BE61D19193042B0A299DA57CC09CDF3.description: Determine the sequence of operations that results in the total number of parts of the whole

886332BA617546D19E820ECFB0707A3D.description: Interpret the product of a fraction times a whole number as total number of parts of the whole

A1CCD37E53E24EC6ADB9C765883D1CD4.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication to multiply a fraction or whole number by a fraction.

CDBE8C747717447985D636AF62423C2C.description:
Solve word problems involving division of whole numbers leading to answers in the form of fractions or mixed
numbers

9E199D6A6647432AA9B4091227CFBD15.description: Interpret a remainder as a fractional part of the problem

2F5E2E4EB8924E9D821A8359B660ED8E.description: Interpret a fraction as division of the numerator by the denominator

4C8C93E128DD4FDCBC90D3522F028826.description: Interpret a fraction as division of the numerator by the denominator (a/b = a ÷ b). Solve word problems involving division of whole numbers leading to answers in the form of fractions or mixed numbers, e.g., by using visual fraction models or equations to represent the problem. For example, interpret 3/4 as the result of dividing 3 by 4, noting that 3/4 multiplied by 4 equals 3, and that when 3 wholes are shared equally among 4 people each person has a share of size 3/4. If 9 people want to share a 50-pound sack of rice equally by weight, how many pounds of rice should each person get? Between what two whole numbers does your answer lie?

03D805298F684F8C81D6D853D7744D86.description:
Solve word problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions with unlike denominators referring to the
same whole

C6F7CF117E1C42949CE01861F090218F.description:
Evaluate the reasonableness of an answer, using fractional number sense, by comparing it to a benchmark
fraction

BDBD8C55B7684CD1A6E6EB1815CEFC22.description: Generate equivalent fractions to find like denominators

69DBE3DEFD654D6086BBBDAF51698281.description: Solve word problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions referring to the same whole, including cases of unlike denominators, e.g., by using visual fraction models or equations to represent the problem. Use benchmark fractions and number sense of fractions to estimate mentally and assess the reasonableness of answers. For example, recognize an incorrect result 2/5 + 1/2 = 3/7, by observing that 3/7 < 1/2.

9C2270B0E5C04029A560F225DF1DF940.description:
Solve addition and subtraction problems involving fractions (including mixed numbers) with like and unlike
denominators using an equivalent fraction strategy

89632B095C8744E8952E879813B59502.description: Generate equivalent fractions to find the like denominator

960912EF44734174BEFDBDB7985AA4DC.description: Add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators (including mixed numbers) by replacing given fractions with equivalent fractions in such a way as to produce an equivalent sum or difference of fractions with like denominators. For example, 2/3 + 5/4 = 8/12 + 15/12 = 23/12. (In general, a/b + c/d = (ad + bc)/bd.)

44ACC319901B40A8826F7113C991C8CA.description: Relate the strategy to a written method and explain the reasoning used to solve decimal operation calculations

EA67A6686D7942AF9286309B45B4DA09.description:
Add, subtract, multiply, and divide decimals to hundredths using concrete models or drawings and strategies
based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction

79FBA9B5FE924EC0953698D1DCDA3401.description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide decimals to hundredths, using concrete models or drawings and strategies based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction; relate the strategy to a written method and explain the reasoning used.

50103ACA1FF141B19199CF7AF66E9711.description: Illustrate and explain division calculations by using equations, rectangular arrays, and/or area models

FCA8AFCE412442AF9D1128213F403D60.description:
Use strategies based on place value, the properties of operations, and/or relationship between multiplication
and division to solve division problems

7DA9CFBC81644270954CB89F95F687C1.description: Find whole-number quotients of whole numbers with up to four-digit dividends and two-digit divisors

25BC1F82E84543B8915AEF1380AE41C0.description: Find whole-number quotients of whole numbers with up to four-digit dividends and two-digit divisors, using strategies based on place value, the properties of operations, and/or the relationship between multiplication and division. Illustrate and explain the calculation by using equations, rectangular arrays, and/or area models.

A566D921043446EBA8B4F98C424E442D.description: Fluently multiply multi-digit whole numbers using the standard algorithm

83FE4E96A53348BB92FCAB5FF226E0C7.description: Use knowledge of base ten and place value to round decimals to any place

B9C23D9399A04876BF9ABDD9BBFF9F8B.description: Compare two decimals to the thousandths, based on the place value of each digit

BB76FE82D1C64B6899CFDA113C58758B.description: Use knowledge of base ten and place value to round decimals to any place

3470A0E6A1D4456F8B03FF0B5B74D9A6.description: Use >, =, and < symbols to record the results of comparisons between decimals

264C1B1277774A9FA33527D4646882EA.description: Read and write decimals to thousandths using base-ten numerals, number names, and expanded form

1C55C7FCD9ED479E82A1F438CDFE4359.description: Read, write, and compare decimals to thousandths.

F1469E83CEB4402A9D0BB897420B7D7D.description: Represent powers of 10 using whole number exponents

AA721E4634F94CF4BAEE9FDA23B26285.description:
Explain the relationship of the placement of the decimal point when a decimal is multiplied or divided by a power
of 10

5AA38C8A9F634906AF9F86461531C0B1.description: Explain the patterns in the number of zeros of the product when multiplying a number by powers of 10

045D13DC72E54EDDBEB709D938B8E9DC.description:
Translate between powers of 10 written as 10 raised to a whole number exponent, in expanded form, and
standard notation

3EFE1B0E26D642528C575908CD7EC274.description: Explain patterns in the number of zeros of the product when multiplying a number by powers of 10, and explain patterns in the placement of the decimal point when a decimal is multiplied or divided by a power of 10. Use whole-number exponents to denote powers of 10.

BABDD7F199424331A41E51C7E76FF1B9.description:
Recognize that in a multi-digit number, a digit in one place represents 10 times as much as it represents in the
place to its right and 1/10 of what it represents in the place to its left.

2882FB8F19574B9099FBF4D8A2468AC5.description: NUMBER AND OPERATIONS IN BASE TEN

A3BEA49CAC3B45DBAC37F046155E56C7.description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with whole number side lengths by packing it with unit cubes

CA8DB0EF4DAF4F6F9B05CD68795E93C7.description:
Solve real world problems by decomposing a solid figure into two non-overlapping right rectangular prisms and
adding their volumes

D34C0C0B428E4C87BE046DD5A2556375.description:
Apply the following formulas to right rectangular prisms having whole number edge lengths in the context of real
world mathematical problems: Volume = length x width x height Volume = area of base x height

752ECF1E97504A28B17903679548A412.description:
Develop volume formula for a rectangle prism by comparing volume when filled with cubes to volume by
multiplying the height by the area of the base, or when multiplying the edge lengths ( L x W x H )

AB03B1ED4B3D402E97AF95731B6CA740.description: Know the “B” is the area of the base

F489FBEBE1934D40AC1D0E55DD64CB01.description: Multiply the three dimensions in any order to calculate volume (Commutative and Associative properties)

50A5CA76AF054B44A625E7F031DF89D8.description: Relate volume to the operations of multiplication and addition and solve real world and mathematical problems involving volume.

DB52053842364904ABAB95C529C4880D.description: Measure volume by counting unit cubes, cubic cm, cubic in, cubic ft, and improvised units

4BEBC72A99F34DFF8EAE7ACE7E022354.description:
Recognize any solid figure packed without gaps or overlaps and filled with n unit cubes indicates the total cubic
units or volume

BFC52BF1688D499F988F725287D57994.description: Recognize a unit cube has 1 cubic unit of volume and is used to measure volume of three-dimensional shapes

AEFE0B0B65DC4A3A82EDF21F90A97BA0.description: Recognize that volume is the measurement of the space inside a solid three-dimensional figure

FEDD30D646E84234A2C1B1B6214EE6C7.description: Recognize volume as an attribute of solid figures and understand concepts of volume measurement.

17F7B2B9339447BDB738A79E1332E873.description:
Solve problems involving information presented in line plots which use fractions of a unit by adding, subtracting,
multiplying, and dividing fractions

021763848F67490AB9F220219DAA9FC1.description: Make a line plot to display a data set of measurements in fractions of a unit

6EEEE6055EB24E9995AF9FE20873F337.description: Make a line plot to display a data set of measurements in fractions of a unit (1/2, 1/4, 1/8). Use operations on fractions for this grade to solve problems involving information presented in line plots. For example, given different measurements of liquid in identical beakers, find the amount of liquid each beaker would contain if the total amount in all the beakers were redistributed equally.

22F56158E6BC416E910E99E09D84724D.description: Solve multi-step, real world problems that involve converting units

D962D91C4D3D4B77920A7E5C32822DC3.description: Convert units of measurement within the same system

D4C7D16361DC41BF83C07C2EB2E7B3F5.description: Divide and multiply to change units

0DDF90580E1046FB8481C3624823D4F3.description: Recognize units of measurement within the same system

A2257125C3D94A26B6898DE116902E5F.description: Convert among different-sized standard measurement units within a given measurement system (e.g., convert 5 cm to 0.05 m), and use these conversions in solving multi-step, real world problems.

36F2704DFCF742E6A2E6CAC682600445.description: Classify two-dimensional figures into categories and/or subcategories based on their attributes

423A8EAB9F3F45959BF5972C0A5EB2EC.description: Analyze properties of two-dimensional figures in order to place into a hierarchy

DB02A804249643F8B73B4D1667B00B7F.description: Recognize the hierarchy of two-dimensional shapes based on their attributes

8301F95B4EF54E37A19FF2D0EE2BAA23.description: Classify two-dimensional figures in a hierarchy based on properties.

912DBE8505BB4E7792F41C3FD9E04B6A.description:
Recognize if a two-dimensional shape is classified into a category, that it belongs to all subcategories of that
category

00CDC620DB354DC69DB5677DFF8DFA52.description:
Recognize that some two-dimensional shapes can be classified into more than one category based on their
attributes

A4600FF8D3B5471F841E916BD5FA1533.description: Understand that attributes belonging to a category of two-dimensional figures also belong to all subcategories of that category. For example, all rectangles have four right angles and squares are rectangles, so all squares have four right angles.

F10E99D115CB4FB8917FCA148F7227F5.description: Represent real world and mathematical problems by graphing points in the first quadrant

E36FB7C0F76B471DACC3B002FB4DA474.description: Interpret coordinate values of points in real world context and mathematical problems

50EB4810A0E04D7EA05221592A4AA296.description: Graph points in the first quadrant

AB4A1DCD610E45F5A3CAB3D9CD1D64F2.description: Represent real world and mathematical problems by graphing points in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane, and interpret coordinate values of points in the context of the situation.

1E5815093CDF4E8E94F553E71BD1B935.description: Recognize and describe the connection between the ordered pair and the x and y axis from the origin

9889380749914814BDB703A6870814A7.description: Identify coordinates of a point on a coordinate system

E9E141C5CAFE4E74BDD67F3488599FB7.description: Locate the origin on the coordinate system

947759F852084A08A877ED47E66D7BE1.description: Identify the x and y axis

81E96957213B4B049220109BCF169DA8.description: Use a pair of perpendicular number lines, called axes, to define a coordinate system, with the intersection of the lines (the origin) arranged to coincide with the 0 on each line and a given point in the plane located by using an ordered pair of numbers, called its coordinates. Understand that the first number indicates how far to travel from the origin in the direction of one axis, and the second number indicates how far to travel in the direction of the second axis, with the convention that the names of the two axes and the coordinates correspond (e.g., x-axis and x-coordinate, y-axis and y-coordinate).
